statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.name: minutes
statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover

statistics.name: rebounds
statistics.description: The total number of rebounds (offensive and defensive).

statistics.name: defensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the defense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot by the offense.

statistics.name: offensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the offense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot.

article.headline: Creighton 79, Illinois State 71
article.story: OMAHA, Neb. (AP) -- Anthony Tolliver scored 23 points on 11-of-11 shooting to lead Creighton past Illinois State 79-71 on Monday at the Qwest Center. Tolliver also grabbed nine rebounds while teammate Nate Funk scored 19 points for the Bluejays (8-4), who improved to 6-0 at home and 2-0 in the Missouri Valley Conference. Creighton held a 38-30 advantage at halftime, thanks to a 15-2 first-half run that gave it a 12-point lead. Nick Porter had six of his 13 points during the surge. The Jays shot 65 percent (15 of 23) from the field before halftime and a season-high 64 percent for the game. Illinois State (8-6) hit 12 three-pointers, including eight by freshman guard Osiris Eldridge, but never fully recovered from Creighton's first-half run. Eldridge, who was 8 of 11 from three-point range, finished with 28 points in his first collegiate start. He pulled the Redbirds within five at 44-39 in the second half before the Bluejays pushed their lead to 14. Levi Dyer scored 13 points and Anthony Slack added 12 for Illinois State, which slipped to 0-3 in the MVC.
